Love it so much! Played it the first time in 2016, and replayed it recently. I just love this game so much, the mechanics are so fun and GLaDoS is a delight to listen to. I think it balances linear storytelling, and feeling like you're choosing your own path, very well. 
Play Portal if you haven't already.

光圈科技完成

8/10
Since Portal is already well known I want to talk about how it felt playing it in 2022 for the first time. Well it was amazing. It still feels very unique after all these years. From the start you’re faced with this super satisfying pace of planning and executing. For people like me who sometimes get bored with puzzle based games, Portal is the best choice because of how wonderful the physics are implemented in it which leaves you experimenting by jumping through portals and figuring out your next move mid air.
Another thing which makes Portal stand out between other puzzle games is how it doesn’t take itself seriously. The story is not that deep yet is unique and interesting. And the actual plot is you having to solve puzzles. So there’s no random out of context stupid puzzle since they all add up with the story.
So if it’s so great then why 8 out of 10 you ask? Cause it’s too damn short. Hey, look, I love short games and I’ve played a lot of them but Portal should not be 2 hours. With this much potential it feels like just a prototype with this length. There’s a lot of mechanics that could be explored much more but there’s just one or two levels of them. In the end Portal leaves you wanting more but not in a good way.
introduces the core mechanic well and then throws you into the deep end
